item.title: Cyberattack Hits England's National Health Service With Ransom Demands
item.description: May 12, 2017 - England's National Health Service is scrambling to respond to a large cyberattack that has crippled its ability to treat patients, after computer users in the public health system were hit.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 12, 2017 - England's National Health Service is scrambling to respond to a large cyberattack that has crippled its ability to treat patients, after computer users in the public health system were hit. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/05/12/528119808/large-cyber-attack-hits-englands-nhs-hospital-system-ransoms-demanded

item.title: Fake Medical News Can Now Be Fact-Checked In India
item.description:
May 12, 2017 - Whatsapp is spreading bogus medical advice in India. A website called Check4Spam is debunking the claims.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/05/12/526687362/fake-medical-news-can-now-be-fact-checked-in-india
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 12, 2017 - Whatsapp is spreading bogus medical advice in India. A website called Check4Spam is debunking the claims. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/05/12/526687362/fake-medical-news-can-now-be-fact-checked-in-india

item.title: What Pepe The Frog's Death Can Teach Us About The Internet
item.description: May 11, 2017 - His creator killed the frog in a comic strip, after the character spent much of 2016 tied to the alt-right. Pepe's sad tale is a modern parable of how awful the Internet can be.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 11, 2017 - His creator killed the frog in a comic strip, after the character spent much of 2016 tied to the alt-right. Pepe's sad tale is a modern parable of how awful the Internet can be. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/05/11/527590762/what-pepe-the-frogs-death-can-teach-us-about-the-internet

item.title: The MP3 Is Officially Dead, According To Its Creators
item.description:
May 11, 2017 - The MP3 upended the way the world receives and hears music, for better and for worse. Now it's dead.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/therecord/2017/05/11/527829909/the-mp3-is-officially-dead-according-to-its-creators
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 11, 2017 - The MP3 upended the way the world receives and hears music, for better and for worse. Now it's dead. http://www.npr.org/sections/therecord/2017/05/11/527829909/the-mp3-is-officially-dead-according-to-its-creators

item.title: Will Foreign Mischief In U.S. Elections Become 'The New Normal'?
item.description: May 11, 2017 - Bitterly divided over the Russian meddling in the 2016 campaign, leaders in Washington so far are not focused on deterring more interference in the next major elections.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 11, 2017 - Bitterly divided over the Russian meddling in the 2016 campaign, leaders in Washington so far are not focused on deterring more interference in the next major elections. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/11/525429568/will-foreign-mischief-in-u-s-elections-become-the-new-normal

item.title: German Publishers' Lawsuit Against Google Threatens To Backfire
item.description: May 10, 2017 - A publishers collective sued the tech giant for copyright payments — but a Berlin court kicked the case to the European Union, to weigh whether the 2013 German law cited by the suit is even valid.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 10, 2017 - A publishers collective sued the tech giant for copyright payments — but a Berlin court kicked the case to the European Union, to weigh whether the 2013 German law cited by the suit is even valid. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/05/10/527800498/german-publishers-lawsuit-against-google-threatens-to-backfire

item.title: New Amazon Building In Seattle Will Include A Homeless Shelter
item.description: May 10, 2017 - The company is donating about half the space in a six-story building to a shelter with room for 65 families. Housing prices in Seattle have skyrocketed, along with the city's business fortunes.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 10, 2017 - The company is donating about half the space in a six-story building to a shelter with room for 65 families. Housing prices in Seattle have skyrocketed, along with the city's business fortunes. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/05/10/527801805/new-amazon-building-in-seattle-will-include-a-homeless-shelter

item.title: ESPN Troubles Cloud Disney Earnings; Apple Surpasses $800 Billion Mark
item.description: May 10, 2017 - Disney reported better-than-expected quarterly earnings, but questions about ESPN's health eclipsed results. Apple is the first U.S. company to surpass the $800 billion mark in market capitalization.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 10, 2017 - Disney reported better-than-expected quarterly earnings, but questions about ESPN's health eclipsed results. Apple is the first U.S. company to surpass the $800 billion mark in market capitalization. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/05/10/527715624/espn-troubles-cloud-disney-earnings-apple-surpasses-800-billion-mark

item.title: NATO Takes Aim At Disinformation Campaigns
item.description: May 10, 2017 - The NATO alliance is dealing with a new perceived threat: disinformation. Steve Inskeep talks with Janis Sarts of the NATO Strategic Communications Centre of Excellence about countermeasures.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 10, 2017 - The NATO alliance is dealing with a new perceived threat: disinformation. Steve Inskeep talks with Janis Sarts of the NATO Strategic Communications Centre of Excellence about countermeasures. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/10/527720078/nato-takes-aim-at-disinformation-campaigns

item.title: FCC Experiences 'Denial-Of-Service' Attacks, Senators Respond
item.description: May 9, 2017 - Two senators have written a letter to FCC Chairman Ajit Pai inquiring into the attacks that took place Sunday night. They overwhelmed the agency's public commenting system.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 9, 2017 - Two senators have written a letter to FCC Chairman Ajit Pai inquiring into the attacks that took place Sunday night. They overwhelmed the agency's public commenting system. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/05/09/527674171/fcc-experiences-denial-of-service-attacks-senators-respond

item.title: Quest For Free Chicken Nuggets Inspires Twitter's Most Retweeted Tweet
item.description: May 9, 2017 - Carter Wilkerson was on a mission to get free chicken nuggets from Wendy's. In the process, he dethroned Ellen DeGeneres' Oscar selfie for the most retweets ever. Oh, and he also got the free nuggets.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 9, 2017 - Carter Wilkerson was on a mission to get free chicken nuggets from Wendy's. In the process, he dethroned Ellen DeGeneres' Oscar selfie for the most retweets ever. Oh, and he also got the free nuggets. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/05/09/527597422/quest-for-free-chicken-nuggets-inspires-twitters-most-retweeted-tweet

item.title: How Draft Horses Are Helping Upgrade Cell Towers In Wisconsin
item.description: May 9, 2017 - A company in Wisconsin has found a low-tech solution to the high-tech problem of maintaining cell phone antennas in hard-to-reach areas. It hearkens back to the state's logging heritage.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 9, 2017 - A company in Wisconsin has found a low-tech solution to the high-tech problem of maintaining cell phone antennas in hard-to-reach areas. It hearkens back to the state's logging heritage. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/09/527541039/draft-horses-are-enlisted-to-help-maintain-remote-cell-towers

item.title: Austrian Court Rules Facebook Must Delete Hate Speech
item.description: May 8, 2017 - The decision could have global consequences: The court ruled that the harsh words against an Austrian politician must be deleted from Facebook worldwide.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 8, 2017 - The decision could have global consequences: The court ruled that the harsh words against an Austrian politician must be deleted from Facebook worldwide. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/05/08/527398995/austrian-court-rules-facebook-must-delete-hate-speech

item.title: After Decades Covering It, Tech Still Amazes Walt Mossberg
item.description: May 8, 2017 - He began covering personal technology in the 1990s, when he says tech columns were written "by geeks for geeks." As he retires, Mossberg reflects on how tech has evolved, often in unexpected ways.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 8, 2017 - He began covering personal technology in the 1990s, when he says tech columns were written "by geeks for geeks." As he retires, Mossberg reflects on how tech has evolved, often in unexpected ways. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/05/08/527407726/after-decades-covering-it-tech-still-amazes-walt-mossberg

item.title: Restaurants With Low Yelp Ratings Suffer Under Higher Minimum Wages
item.description: May 8, 2017 - Minimum wage increases in the San Francisco Bay Area have had an impact on the local restaurant industry, according to a study released by Harvard Business School. Restaurants with low or middling Yelp reviews have become more likely to go out of business. Places with high reviews have been unaffected. The study doesn't attempt to determine whether the wage increases have been good for employees or the local economy overall.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

The study doesn't attempt to determine whether the wage increases have been good for employees or the local economy overall. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/08/527452861/restaurants-with-low-yelp-ratings-suffer-under-higher-minimum-wages
